A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 35 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 33 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 [Lich](/Monsters.aspx?ID=282) **Source** [Bestiary](/Sources.aspx?ID=2) pg. 221 **Perception** +20; darkvision **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20), [Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11) **Skills** [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +28, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +24, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +17, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +19, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +22, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +20 **Str** +0 **Dex** +4 **Con** +0 **Int** +6 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +3 **Items** _potion of [invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164)_, _scroll of [teleport](/Spells.aspx?ID=338)_, [Staff of Fire](/Equipment.aspx?ID=356) --- **AC** 31 **Fort** +17 **Ref** +21 **Will** +23 +1 status to all saves vs. positive **HP** 190 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42), rejuvenation) **Immunities** death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, unconscious **Resistances** cold 10, physical 10 (except magic bludgeoning) **Frightful Presence** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 60 feet, DC 29
**Counterspell** **Trigger** A creature casts a spell the lich has prepared. **Effect** The lich expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature’s casting of that same spell. The lich loses its spell slot as if it had cast the triggering spell. The lich then attempts to counteract the triggering spell. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** hand +24 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 4d8 negative plus paralyzing touch **Arcane Prepared Spells** DC 36, attack +26 - **Cantrips (6th)** [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Mage Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=177), [Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=190), [Ray of Frost](/Spells.aspx?ID=245), [Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=280) - **1st** [Fleet Step](/Spells.aspx?ID=122), [Ray of Enfeeblement](/Spells.aspx?ID=244) (x2), [True Strike](/Spells.aspx?ID=345) - **2nd** [False Life](/Spells.aspx?ID=108), [Mirror Image](/Spells.aspx?ID=197), [Resist Energy](/Spells.aspx?ID=256), [See Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=271) - **3rd** [Blindness](/Spells.aspx?ID=26), [Locate](/Spells.aspx?ID=173), [Magic Missile](/Spells.aspx?ID=180), [Vampiric Touch](/Spells.aspx?ID=354) - **4th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69), [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78), [Fire Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=118), [Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125) - **5th** [Cloudkill](/Spells.aspx?ID=42), [Cone of Cold](/Spells.aspx?ID=47) (x2), [Wall of Ice](/Spells.aspx?ID=364) - **6th** [Chain Lightning](/Spells.aspx?ID=33), [Dominate](/Spells.aspx?ID=87), [Vampiric Exsanguination](/Spells.aspx?ID=353) **Drain [Soul Cage](/Equipment.aspx?ID=488)** **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** The lich taps into its soul cage's power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest level the lich can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells. The lich's soul cage doesn't need to be present for the lich to use this ability. **Paralyzing Touch** ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) A creature damaged by the lich's hand Strike must succeed at a DC 32 Fortitude save. The creature becomes [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31), and seems dead. A DC 25 [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9) check reveals the victim is alive. **Steady Spellcasting** If a reaction would disrupt the lich’s spellcasting action, the lich attempts a DC 15 flat check. On a success, the action isn’t disrupted.
Lich Crafting Liches spend a good deal of their downtime crafting magic items. In particular, a lich will create items that help it defeat and overcome known problems. This fact can prove especially dangerous if the PCs encounter a lich but fail to destroy its [soul cage](/Equipment.aspx?ID=488), for the next time they encounter the lich, it will likely have just the right tools to overcome their defenses.
Lich Treasure The lair of a lich is usually filled with several magical treasures, particularly items that the undead can use based on its spellcasting abilities. Scrolls, wands, and staves are quite common, as are books of lore and tomes containing entirely new spells.
Unique Lichdom The exact ritual, ingredients for deadly concoctions, and magical conditions required to become a lich are unique and different for every living creature. Understanding a spellcaster’s path to lichdom can help, but is no guarantee of success for others.
